instruction.value: DAY 1 of 21. Administer dose in the following volume and at the corrsponding rate: a) Dilute dose in 100 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses less than 90 mg) and administer over 30 minutes to 1 hour. Titration usually not required. b) Dilute dose in 250 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses 90 to 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete infusion over 45 minutes. c) Dilute dose in 500 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses greater than 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete infusion over 1 hour.

DAY 1 of 21. Administer dose in the following volume and at the corrsponding rate: a) Dilute dose in 100 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses less than 90 mg) and administer over 30 minutes to 1 hour. Titration usually not required. b) Dilute dose in 250 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses 90 to 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 45 minutes. c) Dilute dose in 500 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses greater than 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 1 hour.

DAY 1 of 21. Administer dose in the following volume and at the corrsponding rate: a) Dilute dose in 100 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses less than 90 mg) and administer over 30 minutes to 1 hour. Titration usually not required. b) Dilute dose in 250 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses 90 to 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 45 minutes. c) Dilute dose in 500 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses greater than 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 1 hour. [Cycle 1 only]

DAY 1 of 21. Administer dose in the following volume and at the corrsponding rate: a) Dilute dose in 100 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses less than 90 mg) and administer over 30 minutes to 1 hour. Titration usually not required. b) Dilute dose in 250 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses 90 to 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 45 minutes. c) Dilute dose in 500 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses greater than 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 1 hour. [Cycles 2, 3 & 4]

DAY 1 of 21. Administer dose in the following volume and at the corrsponding rate: a) Dilute dose in 100 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses less than 90 mg) and administer over 30 minutes to 1 hour. Titration usually not required. b) Dilute dose in 250 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses 90 to 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 45 minutes. c) Dilute dose in 500 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses greater than 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 1 hour.

DAY 1 of 21. Administer dose in the following volume and at the corrsponding rate: a) Dilute dose in 100 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses less than 90 mg) and administer over 30 minutes to 1 hour. Titration usually not required. b) Dilute dose in 250 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses 90 to 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 45 minutes. c) Dilute dose in 500 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses greater than 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 1 hour. [Cycle 1]

DAY 1 of 21. Administer dose in the following volume and at the corrsponding rate: a) Dilute dose in 100 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses less than 90 mg) and administer over 30 minutes to 1 hour. Titration usually not required. b) Dilute dose in 250 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses 90 to 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 45 minutes. c) Dilute dose in 500 mL - 0.9% sodium chloride (for doses greater than 200 mg) and administer at 100 mL/hour for first 15 minutes, then complete remaining infusion over 1 hour. [Cycles 2 - 4]

Population.value: Fluorouracil, Epirubicin, Cyclophosphamide (FEC) followed by DOCEtaxel. Breast Cancer (NEOADJUVANT Treatment).
Fluorouracil, Epirubicin, Cyclophosphamide (FEC) followed by DOCEtaxel & Trastuzumab
Fluorouracil, Epirubicin, Cyclophosphamide (FEC) followed by DOCEtaxel and Trastuzumab. Breast Cancer (NEOADJUVANT Treatment).
DOXOrubicin, Cyclophosphamide (AC) followed by DOCEtaxel. Breast Cancer (NEOADJUVANT Treatment).
DOXOrubicin, Cyclophosphamide (AC) followed by DOCEtaxel and Trastuzumab. Breast Cancer (NEOADJUVANT Treatment).

AdditionalNotes.value: If ANC is greater than or equal to 1.5 AND Plts are greater than or equal to 100 x 109/L. Give as ordered. If ANC is less than 1.5 OR Plts are less than 100 x 109/L: Delay chemotherapy 1 week.
If ANC is greater than or equal to 1.5 AND Plts are greater than or equal to 100 x 109/L: Give as ordered. If ANC is less than 1.5 OR Plts are less than 100 x 109/L: Delay 1 week.

If ANC is greater than or equal to 1.5 AND Plts are greater than or equal to 100 x 109/L: Give as ordered. If ANC is less than 1.5 OR Plts are less than 100 x 109/L: Delay 1 week. If LVEF is WNL and less than 10% decrease from baseline: Continue treatment. If LVEF is WNL and 10 to 15% decrease from baseline: Continue treatment. If LVEF is WLN and greater than 15% decrease from baseline: Hold treatment. If LVEF is 1 to 5% below LLN and less than 10% decrease from baseline: Continue treatment. If LVEF is 1 to 5% below LLN and 10 to 15% decrease baseline: Hold treatment. If LVEF is 1 to 5% below LLN and greater than 15% decrease from baseline: Hold treatment. If LVEF is greater than 5% below LLN and less than 10% decrease from baseline: Continue treatment. If LVEF is greater than 5% below LLN and 10 to 15% decrease from baseline: Hold treatment. If LVEF is greater than 5% below LLN and greater than 15% decrease from baseline: Hold treatment. Resume if criteria for continuation met. Discontinue if 2 consecutive "holds" or a total of 3 "holds" occur.
If ANC is greater than or equal to 1.5 AND Plts are greater than or equal to 100 x 109/L: Give as ordered. If ANC is less than 1.5 OR Plts are less than 100 x 109/L: Delay 1 week. [Part 2: Cycle 1]
